text: hi I'm Pamela Hines professor and chair
of the department of management science
and engineering at Stanford University I
also serve as the academic director of
Stanford's digital transformation
professional education program
Personally my research focuses on the
effects of technology on teams
collaboration and innovation in
organizations
I'm really delighted to collaborate with
the Maitius Chamber of Commerce and
Industry Business School and serve as
the academic director of our fostering
innovation in the Maitius ecosystem
program We really look forward to using
this program as a platform to share our
innovation frameworks and best practices
from Stanford and the Silicon Valley and
engage in fruitful dialogues with
business leaders to explore creative
ways to address the unique challenges
and opportunities in the region I'd like
to give special thanks to the US embassy
in Maitius who bridge the conversation
with us and to Mr Toridan Schlapperal
CEO of MCCI Business School for his
leadership and tireless effort to make
the collaboration possible This
educational program is a strategic
initiative designed to strengthen the
innovation capacity in Maitius and
adjacent regions The reason is simple
Innovation is no longer something that's
just nice to have but it is an
imperative We're living in a time of
great uncertainty and profound change
Technological advancement is disrupting
industries across the globe As
previously what seemed to be untouchable
established companies are being
overtaken by smaller more nimble
startups that can pivot quickly innovate
continuously and smartly use the latest
technology To be successful and to
thrive organizations must align their
strategies cultures and processes to
this changing digital landscape This
10-week program will cover the essential
mindsets skills and practices that you
need to thrive in a rapidly shifting
business landscape It offers a
comprehensive blend of interactive
online content live instruction
self-paced learning and active learning
activities You'll have a chance to
engage directly with Stamford
instructors including me and my
colleagues professors Melissa Valentine
and Rita Catilla as well as with subject
matter experts from MCCI Business School
who will help you contextualize and
apply your learning to your day-to-day
management practices You'll also work
toward a capstone project where you can
turn your ideas into actionable
strategies and fine-tune them with
feedback from our panel of faculty
experts I can't wait to meet each of you
and embark on this learning journey
together So please join us and I look
forward to seeing you soon
[Music]
